    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ADMIN_FILE
      This file contains secrets for authenticating admin commands issued by a trusted client.
      APPLICATION_NAME
      The name of the application that is used when sending a verification email.
      DNS_GNS_ONLY
      For the DNS service set to true if you want the DNS server to not lookup records using DNS (will only lookup records in the GNS).
      DNS_ONLY
      For the DNS service set to true if you want the DNS server to forward requests to DNS and GNS servers.
      DNS_SERVER_NODES
      For the DNS service set to "all" or a node id if you want to start the DNS server when the app starts.
      DONT_TRY_LOCAL_EMAIL
      Disables the use of the local emailer when sending verification messages.
      ENABLE_DISKMAP
      Uses DiskMapRecords if enabled.
      ENABLE_EMAIL_VERIFICATION
      If enabled, email verfication will be used when account guids are created.
      ENABLE_EMAIL_VERIFICATION_SALT
      If enabled, email salt will be added to the EMAIL_VERIFICATION code.
      ENABLE_SECRET_KEY
      Enables secret key communication that is ~180x faster at signing and ~8x faster at verification.
      EXECUTE_NOOP_ENABLED
      If enabled, the GNS will cache and return the same value for reads.
      GNS_SERVER_IP
      For the DNS service the name of the GNS server to forward GNS requests.
      IN_MEMORY_DB
      Completely turns off mongo or other persistent database provided DiskMap is also enabled.
      INTERNAL_OP_SECRET
      Secret inserted into commands that normally need authentication but are being issued by a trusted internal server.
      LOCAL_NAME_SERVER_NODES
      Set to "all" or a node id if you want to start an instance of the LocalNameServer when the app starts.
      MONGO_PORT
      The default port used by mongo.
      NOSQL_RECORDS_CLASS
      The class used to represent NoSQL records.
      STALE_COMMAND_INTERVAL_IN_MINUTES
      Commands older than this value (send by a client more than this interval ago) will be rejected by the server.
      VERIFICATION_SECRET
      A secret shared between the server and a trusted client in order to circumvent account verification.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • ENABLE_SECRET_KEY

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC ENABLE_SECRET_KEY
        Enables secret key communication that is ~180x faster at signing and ~8x faster at verification. True by default as there is no reason to not support it at the server.

      • ENABLE_DISKMAP

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC ENABLE_DISKMAP
        Uses DiskMapRecords if enabled.

      • IN_MEMORY_DB

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC IN_MEMORY_DB
        Completely turns off mongo or other persistent database provided DiskMap is also enabled.

      • EXECUTE_NOOP_ENABLED

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC EXECUTE_NOOP_ENABLED
        If enabled, the GNS will cache and return the same value for reads. Code-breaking if enabled. Meant only for instrumentation.

      • VERIFICATION_SECRET

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC VERIFICATION_SECRET
        A secret shared between the server and a trusted client in order to circumvent account verification. Must be changed using properties file if manual verification is disabled. Security requirements: (1) The security of the account verification depends on the secrecy of this secret, so the default value must be changed via the properties file in a production setting. (2) SERVER_AUTH SSL must be enabled between clients and servers.

      • INTERNAL_OP_SECRET

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC INTERNAL_OP_SECRET
        Secret inserted into commands that normally need authentication but are being issued by a trusted internal server. We need this because a server can not generate a signature on behalf of a client because only the client has the private key, so if a client issues a multi-step transactional operation that needs to be conducted by an active replica server, the server needs to use this mechanism. Security requirements: (1) The security of most everything in the GNS depends on the secrecy of this secret, so the default value must be changed via the properties file in a production setting. (2) MUTUAL_AUTH SSL must be enabled between the servers. TODO: We might as well set this at bootstrap time to a hash of the contents of keyStore.jks as the contents of that file are meant to be secret anyway and the two have the exact same trust relationship.

      • ADMIN_FILE

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC ADMIN_FILE
        This file contains secrets for authenticating admin commands issued by a trusted client. Security requirements: (1) The contents of this file or the (2) The security of administrative settings (e.g., quote limits) depends on the secrecy of this secret, so the default values of secrets must be changed via the properties file in a production setting. (3) SERVER_AUTH SSL must be enabled between clients and servers.

      • STALE_COMMAND_INTERVAL_IN_MINUTES

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC STALE_COMMAND_INTERVAL_IN_MINUTES
        Commands older than this value (send by a client more than this interval ago) will be rejected by the server.

      • MONGO_PORT

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC MONGO_PORT
        The default port used by mongo. 27017 is the default mongo uses.

      • NOSQL_RECORDS_CLASS

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC NOSQL_RECORDS_CLASS
        The class used to represent NoSQL records.

      • ENABLE_EMAIL_VERIFICATION

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC ENABLE_EMAIL_VERIFICATION
        If enabled, email verfication will be used when account guids are created.

      • ENABLE_EMAIL_VERIFICATION_SALT

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC ENABLE_EMAIL_VERIFICATION_SALT
        If enabled, email salt will be added to the EMAIL_VERIFICATION code. This is needed so we can disable salting in the case where we're using email verification and shared secret verification simultaneously.

      • DONT_TRY_LOCAL_EMAIL

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC DONT_TRY_LOCAL_EMAIL
        Disables the use of the local emailer when sending verification messages. Needed for hosts where the emailer is badly configured and eats outgoing email.

      • APPLICATION_NAME

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC APPLICATION_NAME
        The name of the application that is used when sending a verification email.

      • LOCAL_NAME_SERVER_NODES

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC LOCAL_NAME_SERVER_NODES
        Set to "all" or a node id if you want to start an instance of the LocalNameServer when the app starts.

      • DNS_SERVER_NODES

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC DNS_SERVER_NODES
        For the DNS service set to "all" or a node id if you want to start the DNS server when the app starts.

      • DNS_GNS_ONLY

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC DNS_GNS_ONLY
        For the DNS service set to true if you want the DNS server to not lookup records using DNS (will only lookup records in the GNS).

      • GNS_SERVER_IP

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC GNS_SERVER_IP
        For the DNS service the name of the GNS server to forward GNS requests.

      • DNS_ONLY

        public static final GNSConfig.GNSC DNS_ONLY
        For the DNS service set to true if you want the DNS server to forward requests to DNS and GNS servers.
